related_questions.question: Why is Alexa not working today?
related_questions.snippet: To get your Alexa back online, first check your Wi-Fi connection and restart your router if needed. Then, unplug your Alexa device for about 30 seconds and plug it back in. If it's still offline, open the Alexa app, go to Devices > Echo & Alexa, select your device, and reconnect it to Wi-Fi by following the prompts.
related_questions.title: Why is My Alexa Not Responding? 4 Easy Ways to Fix - Reolink

related_questions.question: Why is Alexa suddenly not working?
related_questions.snippet: Try rebooting the Alexa device by unplugging it from the power source and plugging it back in. Check if the Alexa app on your phone is up-to-date. You can also try reinstalling the app. Try disabling and re-enabling the Alexa skill that you are trying to use.
related_questions.title: Why Does My Alexa Stop Playing Music? | Expert Q&A

related_questions.question: Why is Alexa offline?
related_questions.title: AI Overview
list: Check your Wi-Fi network: Ensure your Wi-Fi is working correctly by testing it with another device.
Verify Wi-Fi password: Make sure you're using the correct password for your network.
Restart your router and modem: Unplug them for 30 seconds, then plug them back in.
Move your device closer to the router: Interference from other devices or distance can weaken the signal.
Restart your Alexa device: Unplug it for 30 seconds, then plug it back in.
Check the power adapter: Ensure it's securely plugged in and working correctly.
Reset your device: If restarting doesn't work, you can try a reset, but be aware this may remove smart home connections.
Check device registration: Go to the Alexa app, navigate to Devices, and verify your device is listed and registered.
Sign out and sign back into the app: This can resolve temporary glitches.
Update the Alexa app: Ensure you have the latest version installed.
Interference: Check for other devices that might be causing interference (microwaves, baby monitors, etc.).
Amazon services outage: In rare cases, there might be a widespread issue with Amazon's servers. You can check for service updates on Amazon's website.
